Text: Payoneer exploits freelancers with excessive fees, including a **$29.95 annual charge**, **$3 per Fiverr withdrawal**, and a **3% currency conversion fee**, significantly reducing earnings. Their **lack of transparency** and **poor customer support** make matters worse. With better alternatives like Wise and Revolut, Payoneer feels like a **"freelancer tax machine."** Avoid if possible, as their unfair fees make them one of the worst payment platforms for independent professionals.

Text: Payoneer is not in compliance with the law. They are not regulated by the Central Bank of the Philippines as an e-money issuer. It's mandatory to accept ePhilID as the same as the Philippine National ID card. This ID is provided alternatively while waiting for the card to be delivered, which may take more than a year as millions are registered. I recommend PayPal instead, which is regulated by the Central Bank of the Philippines and complies with the Data Privacy Act of the Philippines.

Text: I recently encountered a concerning situation with my Payoneer account. Normally, I log in seamlessly, but yesterday, after a week's gap, I was prompted for an OTP, which was unusual. What's more, the OTP came from a personal-looking number, not the usual system-generated type. I didn't use the first OTP and waited for a second, which also came from a similar number. When I reached out to Payoneer's support, they said everything was fine, but I'm still worried about a potential security breach.
